alert.note: Alert for Sheridan Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 18 at 8:34PM MDT until July 18 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MDT TUESDAY... ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northwest winds 35 to 45 mph with gusts up to 60 mph. For the Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 91 occurring. * WHERE...Sheridan Foothills. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 9 AM MDT Tuesday. For the Heat Advisory, until 10 PM MDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Widespread power outages are expected. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Warm and dry conditions could cause rapid fire spread. Use caution with any burning activities. Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses.
info.instruction: Winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Use extra caution and consider postponing travel until winds subside, or take an alternate route. Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Take extra precautions when outside. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing. Try to limit strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Take action when you see symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke.
